meanings.definition: The existence of two or more chemical compounds that are in rapid equilibrium, differing only in the position of a hydrogen atom.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study tautomerisms to understand how molecules can change quickly.
meanings.sent2: Chemists often encounter tautomerisms when analyzing complex compounds.
meanings.sent3: The tautomerisms in the lab were so active, they seemed to be playing a game of musical chairs with hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent4: The tautomerisms danced back and forth, like a never-ending waltz of molecular structures.
meanings.sent5: The concept of tautomerisms can be puzzling at first, but it's fascinating once you grasp it.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of tautomers, or structural isomers that readily interconvert.
meanings.sent1: Tautomerisms can lead to different forms of the same molecule.
meanings.sent2: The tautomerisms of certain compounds can be quite unpredictable.
meanings.sent3: The tautomerisms at the chemical party kept switching partners, causing quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: In the world of molecules, tautomerisms are like shape-shifters, always transforming.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained tautomerisms with colorful illustrations to make it easier to grasp.
